column2: Rabbinic Judaism is the major religion of the Ashkenazi and Sephardic Jews in Europe.
The Grand Sanhedrin is the reformation of Rabbinic Judaism where the courts are more important than the kohens from the Tribe of Levi. This has caused a schism between them and Temple Judaism.
This is a branch of Judaism that Beta-Israel follows.
Temple Judaism rejects the Sanhedrin and follows the Torah only. This has created a schism between Temple Judaism and the Rabbis of Rabbinic Judaism and the Grand Sanhedrin.
The Grand Sanhedrin is the reformation of Rabbinic Judaism where the courts are more important than the kohens from the Tribe of Levi. This has caused a schism between them and Temple Judaism.
The Samaritan Pentatauch is the Samaritan version of the Pentatauch. It contains 6,000 differences between it and the Hebrew Torah.
Milchemet Kodesh is Hebrew for Holy War.
Milchemet Kodesh is Hebrew for Holy War.
Chasid is the Hebrew word for Piety.
Chasid is the Hebrew word for Piety.
Mashafa Kedus is the Haymanot Judaism name for their holy scriptures.
Reforming of Rabbinic Judaism into the Grand Sanhedrin.
Reforming of Karaite into Temple Judaism.

Nazarenes are the original Christians, but were never referred as such. They were the first followers of Yeshua Im'manua'el during his earthly ministry to the Jews. It wasn't until after the Bar Kokhba Revolt that Gentile followers of Yeshua distanced themselves from their Jewish counterparts with the use of Christian.
Ebionites were the first schism in the Nazarene church. Ebionites rejected the divinity of Yeshua and incorporated gnosticism.
Kohens are the priests from the Tribe of Levi that administer the Jewish rites.
Kohens are the priests from the Tribe of Levi that administer the Jewish rites.
Exilarchs are descended from King David's line and control the Jewish people under various empires.
Kes is the title of the priests of Haymanot Judaism.
Liqa Kahnet is the high priest of Haymanot Judaism that is equal to the Kohen Gadol.
Muflas are members of the Sanhedrin that oversee the courts and religious functions of the Rabbinic branch of Judaism.
Muflas are members of the Sanhedrin that oversee the courts and religious functions of the Rabbinic branch of Judaism.
Melech is the ancient Hebrew name for King.

column3: Melech is the ancient Hebrew name for King.

Mizrahim are Jewish people from the first diaspora that began when the Babylonians expelled many Jews from Israel in 722 BC.

The Itali Jews are the ancestors of the Ashkenazi of Europe
Iberian Jews are the ancestors of the Sephardic Jews of Hispania.

Romaniote Jews are Jews that settled in Greece circa 70 CE.
The Jews of Beta Yisrael are descended from members of the Tribe of Dan that had settled in Ethiopia.

column1: #Beginning of Israel Game (Event Troops and Dynasty Traits)																			10000-10099

column2: The time of the Exilarch has ended with the creation of the Kingdom of Israel by the Jews.
Blessed be Yahweh and may his light shine forever.
The Kingdom of Israel is reborn.
column4: Das Königreich Israel ist neu geboren.

column2: With Jerusalem and the Promised Land under Jewish control, the time is ripe for the creation of a new United Monarchy named Israel - like the great kingdom of ancient times under David and Solomon.\n\nThe long-suffering Jewish people are finally in control of their own destiny again. No longer shall the Holy Land be torn asunder by warring Christian and Muslim lords. May this new kingdom usher in an era of peace and prosperity for the region!
column3: Maintenant que Jérusalem et la Terre promise sont sous contrôl juif, il est temps de recréer une monarchie unie, Israël, semblable au grand royaume des temps anciens qui brilla sous le règne du légendaire roi David, son fondateur, et Salomon, fils de David et bâtisseur du Premier Temple.\n\nLe peuple juif, qui a tant souffert, reprend enfin sa destinée en main. La Terre Promise ne sera plus jamais déchirée par les luttes ces belliqueux chrétiens et musulmans. Que ce nouveau royaume annonce, c'est une ère de paix et de prospérité pour la région !
column4: Mit Jerusalem und dem Gelobten Land unter jüdischer Herrschaft ist die Zeit reif für die Schaffung einer neuen Vereinigten Monarchie namens Israel - wie das große Königreich der Antike unter Salomo und David. \n\nNach der langen Leidenszeit der Vertreibung ist das jüdische Volk endlich wieder Herr seines Schicksals. Nie wieder soll das Heilige Land zerrissen werden durch die Kriege christlicher und muslimischer Herrscher. Möge das neue Königreich der Region eine Ära von Frieden und Wohlstand bescheren!
column6: Con Jerusalén y la Tierra Prometida bajo control judío, es el momento oportuno para crear una nueva monarquía unida llamada Israel, como el gran reino de la antigüedad gobernado por David y Salomón.\n\nEl pueblo judío, que tanto ha sufrido, controlará por fin su propio destino de nuevo. La Tierra Santa ya no será nunca más despedazada por los señores de la guerra cristianos y musulmanes. ¡Que este nuevo reino traiga una era de paz y prosperidad a la región!

column2: I have become responsible for my own actions and sins. No longer will I hide behind my parents for my irresponsibilities or sins. My parents should be proud of who I have become.
My son is growing up fast. Today, he is now accountable for his own actions. I'm no longer held responsible for his sins and failures before the community and Yahweh.

column1: #Jewish Holy Orders		10300-10399 The Maccabean Guard, Knights of Khazaria, Lions of Solomon, Knights of Goshen, The Siqariqim,and The Mishkan Guardians

column2: Named after the revolt that established the Levite led Hasmonean kingdom, the Maccabean Guard are soldiers dedicated to the Temple and Kohen Gadol. Whilst their purpose is ostensibly to defend the priesthood from infidels and foreign invaders, some speculate that the true reason for their creation is to give the Priesthood a tool to use against the Monarchy.
Could they be used against the Monarchy?
It's a necessary precaution to protect them.
[From.GetFromRelation] volunteers to join The Maccabean Guard.
You tell [From.GetFromRelation] that it would be a bad idea to go.
[From.GetFromRelation] asks for your permission to join The Maccabean Guard.
You agree to let him join.
[From.GetFromRelation] says their goodbyes and leaves your household to join The Maccabean Guard. You and your family pray to Adonai for his safety as he grows smaller in the distance.
You tell [From.GetFromRelation] that joining The Maccabean Guard will put their life at risk and they could come home either dead or maimed from all the battles they will be fighting.
It is for the best for my [From.GetFromRelation].

With the rise of the Mashiakh in the land of Israel the world is entering a new age. By order of the king, and with the blessing of the Kohen Gadol, a new order of holy warriors is being assembled in the land of the Khazars. Taking inspirations from the Christian knightly orders, the Knights of Khazaria shall ride forth, to do battle with the heathens that surround them and make the steppes safe for the followers of Hashem. For as it is written, in the age of Mashiakh every knee shall bend and every tongue swear loyalty to him.
We ride in the name of Yahweh!
We can use all the help we can.
[From.GetFromRelation] volunteers to join the Knights of Khazaria.

It is for the best for my [From.GetFromRelation].

The Jews of Abyssinia have long suffered the disdain of their infidel neighbours, but they shall suffer these indignities no more! The Lions of Solomon shall fight to defend the chosen of Hashem, and to spread his glory across all of Africa. For as it is written, in the age of Mashiakh every knee shall bend and every tongue swear loyalty to him.
We fight in the name of Yahweh!
We can use all the help we can.

In the land where we once were slaves, now we have returned as conquerors. By order of the Kohen Gadol, the Knights of Goshen ride, to defend the Holy Land from the infidel, and to subjugate our old enemy in the name of Hashem. For as it is written, in the age of Mashiakh every knee shall bend and every tongue swear loyalty to him.
We fight in the name of Yahweh!
We can use all the help we can.

Taking inspiration from the ancient sect of fanatical of Sicarii or “dagger-men”, who fought against the Romans and their sympathisers in the years leading up to the second exile, these fanatics have taken up the dagger in the name of cleansing the land of all they regard as profane and impious, be they prince, priest or pauper. Striking swiftly and without mercy the Siqariqim will stop at nothing to cut out the rot that has infected the land. They do not forget. They do not forgive. Expect them.
May their enemies learn to fear Adonai!

The Siqariqim have become too much of a hassal and have created too much havoc. They are uncontrollable, so you have ordered your loyal troops to hunt down every last member of their order. The battles raged all across your kingdom as they have been destroyed one holding at a time.
You have taken it upon yourself to rebuild the Siqariqim to their former glory. With the Siqariqim rebuilt they can spread fear and dread amongst the enemies of Israel.

You wake suddenly in cold sweat with a strong sensation that something is amiss. The flickering candlelight in your tent reveals a plate of hot biscuits and a note pinned by a poisoned dagger next to your bed. It reads: "Mend your decadent ways before it is too late, [Root.GetFirstName]. The Siqariqim are watching."
Perhaps the time for change has come...
One of your servants, [From.GetTitledName], has been executed by the Siqariqim by having [From.GetHerHis] throat slit.

Master, terrible news! Your faithful servant, [From.GetTitledName], has been found dead in [From.GetHerHis] home, no doubt at the hands of the vile Siqariqim. Carved by knife into [From.GetHerHis] chest were the words: "[Root.GetFirstName] - You were warned."
As you turn a street corner in [Root.Location.GetName], a strange whistling sound swishes past your ear. Your bodyguards topple over, knives in their throats, and before you can react y
column15: xou are surrounded by robed Siqariqim. Their leader approaches you with a sad look on his face. "May you find what you seek in the life hereafter, friend."

column2: But... but I am not ready!

[From.GetTitledName] staggers past your guards, bleeding profusely from a dozen stab-wounds. As [From.GetSheHe] collapses in a pool of blood at your feet, [From.GetSheHe] gasps with [From.GetHerHis] last breath: "The S-Siqariqim..."

Your guards bring in a covered basket left just outside your palace. Believing it to be confections from one of your subjects, you hungrily pull away the covering blanket only to reveal the severed, gaping head of [From.GetTitledName]. The mark of the Siqariqim has been carved into the forehead.
I think I've lost my appetite...

As you stroll through your palace garden with [From.GetTitledFirstName], you see the brief glint of reflected sunlight on metal as a thrown dagger flashes past and buries itself in your friend's throat. Your bodyguards rush you to safety, but you glimpse a robed assassin scurrying over the palace walls...
The Siqariqim! Was I the intended target?

[From.GetTitledName] stumbles into your throne room with a trail of blood following [From.GetHerHis]. [From.GetHerHis] collapses at the foot of your dais with several daggers protruding from [From.GetHerHis] back.

You wake suddenly in cold sweat with a strong sensation that something is amiss. The flickering candlelight in your tent reveals a plate of hot biscuits and a note pinned by a poisoned dagger next to your bed. It reads: "There are a thousand ways to kill a [Root.GetManWoman], [Root.GetFirstName]. The Siqariqim know them all.
[From.GetTitledName] has been assassinated by the Siqariqim. [From.GetHerHis] head was decapitated and left for [From.GetHerHis] relatives.
No one is safe from the Siqariqim!
With the return of the Ark of the Covenant to the Holy Temple, a new order of holy warriors was established to stand guard over it and ensure that it will never again fall into enemy hands.
May Adonai protect them as they guard the Ark!

In the land where we once were slaves, now we have returned as conquerors. By order of the Kohen Gadol, the Martyrs of James the Just ride, to defend the Holy Land from the infidel, and to subjugate our old enemy in the name of Hashem. For as it is written, in the age of Mashiakh every knee shall bend and every tongue swear loyalty to him.
We fight in the name of Yahweh!
We can use all the help we can.

column1: #Jewish Holy Festivals			Purim, Rosh Hashanah, Shavout, Hanukkah																10500-10599

column2: Purim is the celebration of the Jewish people being saved from Haman and his genocide.
Known as the Feast of Weeks, Shavuot commerates when Yahweh gave the Torah to the Jewish people and also marks the harvest of the wheat.
Hanukkah is the festival of lights. It celebrates the miracle of the oil lamps in the temple remaining lit for 8 days.
Rosh Hashanah is the beginning of the Jewish new year.
Sukkot is the celebration of the end of the year harvest and the time the Israelites wandered in the desert for 40 years.
Yom Kippur is the celebration of the Jewish new year and the cleansing of their sins.

Purim is one of the holiest days for the Jewish people since it celebrates the deliverance of the Persian Jews from the evil Haman. The events are recorded in the Book of Esther and is recited during the celebrations.
Known as the Feast of Weeks, Shavuot commerates when Yahweh gave the Torah to the Jewish people and also marks the harvest of the wheat.
Hanukkah is the festival of lights. It celebrates the miracle of the oil lamps in the temple remaining lit for 8 days and the rededication of the temple after the Maccabean Revolt.
Rosh Hashanah is the beginning of the Jewish new year.
Sukkot is the celebration of the end of the year harvest and the time the Israelites wandered in the desert for 40 years.
Yom Kippur is the celebration of the Jewish new year and the cleansing of their sins.

column1: #Rebuilding Jerusalem small event chain that adds more modifiers to the province holdings											10600-10699

column2: It has come time for you to make a decision regarding the rebuilding of Jerusalem.
Make the city the Jewel of the Levant again!
After completing the prior rebuilding you can further improve the city to make it even more spectacular.
Strengthen all the walls of Jerusalem.
Add to the Upper and Lower City plus strengthen the walls!
Rebuilding Jerusalem's Upper City to make it the marvel it used to be.
Rebuilding Jerusalem's Lower City to increase the markets and the taxes it brings.
Rebuilding Jerusalem's Gates will make the city more beautiful because of their ornate and intricate details. Each one is different from the others.

The city of David is the height of Jerusalem's shining jewel. It has beautiful works of art plus grandiose architecture that adds to the wonder of Jerusalem. Truly this is how Adonai meant for Jerusalem to be.
Rebuild Jerusalem back to being the jewel of the Levant.

For as long as have ruled here we have entrusted the raising of our children to Jewish nursemaids. Our first words would not be the language of our forefathers but Hebrew. As we grew up we learned to speak a tongue that was neither one nor the other. Now is this time to make this tongue our own so we may all communicate.
Yes let us be one with our serfs

Around our lands more people are using this Hebrew language and I find this is a perfect means for my serfs to work properly. We continue to use our own influence to promote this means of communication in the interests of more efficient realm.

Although every civilised man in Jewishdom knows that Hebrew is the true language of communication, our Hebrew language does have a certain functionality. I have therefore prevailed upon a member of my court to adopt this for everyday administrative use.

I was considering important business when I had an amazing insight. To strengthen my realm I must bring my vassals round to my way of thinking. This involves communication. If I can get them to communicate like me then I will have a much smoother running realm.
My liege has persuaded me to embrace this notion of Jewishness that is sweeping the realm.

With the construction of the Third Temple and the restoration of the Kingdom of Israel complete, the time has come for a decision to reinstate the priesthood and the resumption of sacrifices at the temple. By reinstating the priesthood, you are choosing to reform [Root.Religion.GetName] into Temple Judaism. In Temple Judaism, the priesthood and Jerusalem as the center of religious focus are most important. All decisions are left to the Tribe of Levi and for you to execute their will. Followers may go on pilgrimages and set the interval for when sacrifices are performed.

The Grand Sanhedrin are a religious movement that emerged out of Rabbinic Judaism after the restoration of the Third Temple, taking inspiration from the historical Pharisees that were popular prior to the destruction of the second temple, and who some see as the forerunners of the Rabbinic tradition. Whilst the Grand Sanhedrin accept the reinstitution of the Temple and Priesthood, as well as the rituals and ceremonies that come with it, they have a number of objections to the power and authority that is being concentrated in the hands of the Levites, instead arguing that interpretation and judicial authority should rest in the Sanhedrins (religious courts) rather than the priesthood. In addition they also support the authority of the Oral Torah.
Rabbinic Judaism is still the best.

The Grand Sanhedrin are a religious movement that emerged out of Rabbinic Judaism after the restoration of the Third Temple, taking inspiration from the historical Pharisees that were popular prior to the destruction of the second temple, and who some see as the forerunners of the Rabbinic tradition. Whilst the Grand Sanhedrin accept the reinstitution of the Temple and Priesthood, as well as the rituals and ceremonies that come with it, they have a number of objections to the power and authority that is being concentrated in the hands of the Levites, instead arguing that interpretation and judicial authority should rest in the Sanhedrins (religious courts) rather than the priesthood. In addition they also support the authority of the Oral Torah.
The Tribe of Levi has too much power.
A Jewish courtier appears at the gates to your castle seeking refuge. They look like they have useful skills that will enable you to be stronger.
Adonai watches over his faithful servants!

There has not been a Kohen Gadol – a High Priest of Judaism – since the Romans destroyed the Second Temple roughly a thousand years ago. At long last, this position has been filled and the High Priesthood reconstituted.\n\nLike the Jewish priests of ancient times, the Kohen Gadol was traditionally required to be a descendant of Aaron, the older brother of Moses and from the Tribe of Levi. The Priesthood has moved into the living quarters and established itself at the Third Temple.
